lu_object_operations Struct Reference
[lu]

Operations specific for particular lu_object. More...

#include <lu_object.h>

Detailed Description

Operations specific for particular lu_object.

Field Documentation

void(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_delete)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)

Called before lu_object_operations::loo_object_free() to signal that object is being destroyed.

Dual to lu_object_operations::loo_object_init().

Referenced by lu_object_free().

void(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_free)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)

Dual to lu_device_operations::ldo_object_alloc().

Called when object is removed from memory.

Referenced by lu_object_free().

int(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_init)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o, const struct lu_object_conf *conf)

Allocate lower-layer parts of the object by calling lu_device_operations::ldo_object_alloc() of the corresponding underlying device.

This method is called once for each object inserted into object stack. It's responsibility of this method to insert lower-layer object(s) it create into appropriate places of object stack.

Referenced by lu_object_alloc().

int(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_invariant)(const struct lu_object *o)

Optional debugging method.

Returns true iff method is internally consistent.

Referenced by lu_object_invariant().

int(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_print)(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie, lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)

Optional debugging helper.

Print given object.

Referenced by lu_object_print().

void(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_release)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)

Called when last active reference to the object is released (and object returns to the cache).

This method is optional.

Referenced by lu_object_put().

int(* lu_object_operations::loo_object_start)(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)

Called (in top-to-bottom order) during object allocation after all layers were allocated and initialized.

Can be used to perform initialization depending on lower layers.

Referenced by lu_object_alloc().
